questions: This principle can show the weight of the object by elongating and deforming the object. *squash and stretch*
You would use this princple to show that a character was getting ready to jump by having the character crouch first. *anticipation*
This is the presentation of an idea so that it is completely obvious what to look at on the screen. *staging*
By using *arcs*, you can show more organic motion. This is the way most living creatures move. For example the motion a character's hand might make when throwing a ball.
When you consider *timing*, the more frames you have, the slower the action. The less frames the quicker the action.
When animating a cat jumping you can use *follow through* to show the tail continue to move after the cat lands
